Package it.polimi.ingsw.ps51.controller

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.ps51.utility.Observable<EventForClient>
it.polimi.ingsw.ps51.controller.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameObserver, Observer<EventForServer>
public class Game
extends Observable<EventForClient>
implements GameObserver
The class manage a game match, from its setup to the end of it

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    protected class  Game.PhaseFour
    This thread is needed to manage the fourth phase of the setup, that one where the players must choose where to collocates their workers

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addObserver​(Observer newObserver)
    To add an observer to the list
    void assignController​(Gods god)
    This method assign to the actual player the God he chose, initialize all the needed classes as the right controller for the game turn and update the map that save the correspondences between player and relative GodController, finally asks to the next player to choose a god from the remaining ones if he doesn't already done this.
    void colorAssignment​(WorkerColor color)
    This method manage the choice of the player about the color of their workers
    GodController getActualController()
    The method retrieve the GodController associated to the actual player
    void phaseThree​(java.lang.String firstPlayer)
    Third phase of the game setting needed before the match can start.
    void startGame()
    This method start the procedure to setup correctly the playground, assigning gods to the player and place their workers on the map, this method in particular extract casually a player and ask him to choose as many gods as the number of players in the match
    void startGamePhaseTwo​(java.util.List<Gods> godsList)
    This method continues the setup of the match, it's the phase two, where, after receiving the list of gods from the challenger, is asked to each player to choose a god from the previously mentioned list.
    void update​(ControllerToGame message)
    Menage a message coming from the GodController of the actual player
    void update​(EventForServer message)
    Manage the receiving of a message coming from the client, the management is delegated to the visitor

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game​(Playground gameRoom)
      This is the constructor of the class
      Parameters:
      gameRoom - it's the Playground that gives to the controller the access to the model

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      This method start the procedure to setup correctly the playground, assigning gods to the player and place their workers on the map, this method in particular extract casually a player and ask him to choose as many gods as the number of players in the match

    • startGamePhaseTwo

      public void startGamePhaseTwo​(java.util.List<Gods> godsList)
      This method continues the setup of the match, it's the phase two, where, after receiving the list of gods from the challenger, is asked to each player to choose a god from the previously mentioned list. The first player that is asked to choose is the successive of the challenger and so on until all the players chose a god
      Parameters:
      godsList - the list of gods chosen by the challenger

    • assignController

      public void assignController​(Gods god)
      This method assign to the actual player the God he chose, initialize all the needed classes as the right controller for the game turn and update the map that save the correspondences between player and relative GodController, finally asks to the next player to choose a god from the remaining ones if he doesn't already done this. When all the player have chosen a god the method start the thirdPhase
      Parameters:
      god - the God chosen by the actual player

    • phaseThree

      public void phaseThree​(java.lang.String firstPlayer)
      Third phase of the game setting needed before the match can start. In this phase will be set who is the player that start the match
      Parameters:
      firstPlayer - the nickname of the first player to game

    • colorAssignment

      public void colorAssignment​(WorkerColor color)
      This method manage the choice of the player about the color of their workers
      Parameters:
      color - the color chosen by the player

    • getActualController

      public GodController getActualController()
      The method retrieve the GodController associated to the actual player
      Returns:
      the GodController of the actual player

    • update

      public void update​(EventForServer message)
      Manage the receiving of a message coming from the client, the management is delegated to the visitor
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<EventForServer>
      Parameters:
      message - the object which have to be updated

    • update

      public void update​(ControllerToGame message)
      Menage a message coming from the GodController of the actual player
      Specified by:
      update in interface GameObserver
      Parameters:
